summary: This is a civil complaint filed by 'Jane Doe 1000' against the executors of Jeffrey Epstein's estate, Darren K. Indyke and Richard D. Kahn. The plaintiff alleges she was recruited, sexually trafficked, and abused by Epstein and his co-conspirators, including Ghislaine Maxwell, in New York and Florida. The complaint details Epstein's sex trafficking enterprise and seeks damages for battery and intentional infliction of emotional distress.

persons.name: Jane Doe 1000
persons.context: Plaintiff who alleges she was recruited, trafficked, and sexually abused by Jeffrey Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell from late 1999 onward.

persons.name: Jeffrey Edward Epstein
persons.role: Deceased defendant, financier, accused sex trafficker
persons.context: Central figure accused of operating a transcontinental sex trafficking network, sexually abusing the plaintiff and many others. Died in August 2019.

persons.name: Darren K. Indyke
persons.context: Named defendant sued in his capacity as an appointed executor of the Estate of Jeffrey Epstein.

persons.name: Richard D. Kahn
persons.context: Named defendant sued in his capacity as an appointed executor of the Estate of Jeffrey Epstein.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Described as one of Epstein's main 'recruiters' who directed the plaintiff to Epstein and participated in a sexual assault against her.

persons.name: Kenneth Marra
persons.context: Judge who made findings in a prior case regarding Epstein's sexual abuse of more than 30 minor girls.

persons.name: Les Wexner
persons.role: Chief executive of Victoria's Secret parent company
persons.context: Identified as a friend of Epstein's; Epstein used his connection to Wexner to lure the plaintiff with promises of modeling opportunities.

persons.name: Richard Berman
persons.context: Judge who formally dismissed the SDNY indictment against Epstein after his death.

persons.name: Martel Colon Miro
persons.context: One of the witnesses to Jeffrey Epstein's last will and testament, executed in jail.

persons.name: Gulnora Tali
persons.context: One of the witnesses to Jeffrey Epstein's last will and testament, executed in jail.

persons.name: David Boies
persons.context: Attorney from Boies Schiller Flexner LLP representing Jane Doe 1000.

persons.name: Joshua I. Schiller
persons.context: Attorney from Boies Schiller Flexner LLP representing Jane Doe 1000.

persons.name: Sigrid McCawley
persons.context: Attorney from Boies Schiller Flexner LLP representing Jane Doe 1000 (pro hac vice pending).

connections.description: Maxwell is described as one of Epstein's main 'recruiters' who worked with him to procure and abuse young females. They allegedly sexually assaulted the plaintiff together.
Epstein allegedly recruited, trafficked, and sexually abused the plaintiff over a period of years.
Epstein claimed to be friends with Wexner and used this connection to lure the plaintiff with promises of modeling jobs at Victoria's Secret.
Indyke served as an executor of Epstein's estate and swore an 'Oath of Willingness to Serve as Executor' in Epstein's will.
Kahn served as an executor of Epstein's estate and filed a Certificate of Trust for Epstein's 1953 Trust.
Maxwell allegedly recruited the plaintiff and later participated in a sexual assault against her.

events.title: Plaintiff's recruitment and initial abuse
events.description: Jane Doe 1000, after a modeling appearance, was contacted by a man and introduced to Jeffrey Epstein at his New York mansion under false pretenses of modeling opportunities. The abuse began.

events.title: Epstein's Florida plea deal
events.description: Epstein pleaded guilty to a single Florida state charge of procuring a minor for prostitution and entered a non-prosecution agreement (NPA) with the U.S. Attorney for the Southern District of Florida.

events.title: Epstein's arrest by SDNY
events.description: Epstein was arrested pursuant to a sealed indictment from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York charging him with sex trafficking conspiracy and sex trafficking.

events.title: Execution of Epstein's will
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein executed his last will and testament at the Metropolitan Correctional Center, witnessed by Martel Colon Miro and Gulnora Tali.

events.title: Death of Jeffrey Epstein
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was found dead in his cell at the Metropolitan Correctional Center.

events.title: Dismissal of criminal indictment
events.description: U.S. District Judge Richard Berman formally dismissed the SDNY indictment against Epstein following his death, terminating the criminal action.

locations: 9 East 71st Street, New York, New York 10021 (Epstein's New York mansion)
49 Zorro Ranch Road, Stanley, New Mexico 87056 (Epstein's ranch)
keyFacts: The plaintiff, Jane Doe 1000, alleges she was recruited in late 1999, sexually trafficked, and abused for years by Jeffrey Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell in New York and Florida.

Epstein's sex trafficking enterprise allegedly involved recruiting young females with false promises, using his wealth and connections to intimidate them, and lending them out to other powerful individuals.
The complaint references a prior finding by Judge Kenneth Marra that Epstein sexually abused more than 30 minor girls between about 1999 and 2007.
Epstein's 2008 non-prosecution agreement (NPA) with Florida prosecutors is cited as allowing him to escape proportionate punishment and continue his enterprise.
The complaint alleges a specific incident where Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell simultaneously sexually assaulted the plaintiff by forcible compulsion.
